1use core::{
2    fmt::Debug,
3    ops::{Deref, Range},
4};
5
6use crate::{cache::node::NodeBase, FdtError, Phandle};
7use alloc::{vec, vec::Vec};
8
9/// PCI address space type.
10#[derive(Clone, Debug, PartialEq)]
11pub enum PciSpace {
12    /// I/O space
13    IO,
14    /// 32-bit memory space
15    Memory32,
16    /// 64-bit memory space
17    Memory64,
18}
19
20/// A PCI address range for address translation.
21#[derive(Clone, Debug, PartialEq)]
22pub struct PciRange {
23    /// The address space type
24    pub space: PciSpace,
25    /// The address on the PCI bus
26    pub bus_address: u64,
27    /// The address in CPU physical memory
28    pub cpu_address: u64,
29    /// The size of the range
30    pub size: u64,
31    /// Whether the memory is prefetchable
32    pub prefetchable: bool,
33}
34
35/// A PCI interrupt mapping entry from the interrupt-map property.
36#[derive(Clone, Debug)]
37pub struct PciInterruptMap {
38    /// The child device address (masked)
39    pub child_address: Vec<u32>,
40    /// The child interrupt pin (masked)
41    pub child_irq: Vec<u32>,
42    /// The phandle of the interrupt parent controller
43    pub interrupt_parent: Phandle,
44    /// The interrupt specifier for the parent controller
45    pub parent_irq: Vec<u32>,
46}
47
48/// Interrupt information for a PCI device.
49#[derive(Clone, Debug, PartialEq)]
50pub struct PciInterruptInfo {
51    /// The interrupt lines/numbers for this device
52    pub irqs: Vec<u32>,
53}
54
55/// A PCI device tree node.
56#[derive(Clone)]
57pub struct Pci {
58    node: NodeBase,
59}
60
61impl Pci {
62    pub(crate) fn new(node: NodeBase) -> Self {
63        Pci { node }
64    }
65
66    /// Get the number of interrupt cells for PCI devices.
67    pub fn interrupt_cells(&self) -> u32 {
68        self.find_property("#interrupt-cells")
69            .and_then(|prop| prop.u32().ok())
70            .unwrap_or(1) // Default to 1 interrupt cell for PCI
71    }
72
73    /// Get the interrupt-map-mask property if present
74    pub fn interrupt_map_mask(&self) -> Option<Vec<u32>> {
75        self.node
76            .find_property("interrupt-map-mask")
77            .and_then(|prop| {
78                let mut data = prop.data.buffer();
79                let mut mask = Vec::new();
80                while !data.remain().as_ref().is_empty() {
81                    match data.take_u32() {
82                        Ok(value) => mask.push(value),
83                        Err(_) => return None,
84                    }
85                }
86                Some(mask)
87            })
88    }
89
90    /// Parse the interrupt-map property into a structured format
91    pub fn interrupt_map(&self) -> Result<Vec<PciInterruptMap>, FdtError> {
92        let prop = self
93            .node
94            .find_property("interrupt-map")
95            .ok_or(FdtError::PropertyNotFound("interrupt-map"))?;
96
97        let mut mask = self
98            .interrupt_map_mask()
99            .ok_or(FdtError::PropertyNotFound("interrupt-map-mask"))?;
100
101        let mut data = prop.data.buffer();
102        let mut mappings = Vec::new();
103
104        // Calculate the size of each entry in interrupt-map
105        // Format: <child-address child-irq interrupt-parent parent-irq...>
106        let child_addr_cells = self.address_cells() as usize;
107        let child_irq_cells = self.interrupt_cells() as usize;
108
109        let required_mask_len = child_addr_cells + child_irq_cells;
110        if mask.len() < required_mask_len {
111            mask.resize(required_mask_len, 0xffff_ffff);
112        }
113
114        while !data.remain().as_ref().is_empty() {
115            // Parse child address (variable number of cells for PCI)
116            let mut child_address = Vec::with_capacity(child_addr_cells);
117            for _ in 0..child_addr_cells {
118                child_address.push(
119                    data.take_u32()
120                        .map_err(|_| FdtError::BufferTooSmall { pos: data.pos() })?,
121                );
122            }
123
124            // Parse child IRQ (usually 1 cell for PCI)
125            let mut child_irq = Vec::with_capacity(child_irq_cells);
126            for _ in 0..child_irq_cells {
127                child_irq.push(
128                    data.take_u32()
129                        .map_err(|_| FdtError::BufferTooSmall { pos: data.pos() })?,
130                );
131            }
132
133            // Parse interrupt parent phandle
134            let interrupt_parent_raw = data
135                .take_u32()
136                .map_err(|_| FdtError::BufferTooSmall { pos: data.pos() })?;
137            let interrupt_parent = if interrupt_parent_raw == 0 {
138                self.interrupt_parent_phandle().unwrap_or(Phandle::from(0))
139            } else {
140                Phandle::from(interrupt_parent_raw)
141            };
142
143            let irq_parent = self
144                .node
145                .interrupt_parent()
146                .ok_or(FdtError::NodeNotFound("interrupt-parent"))?;
147
148            let address_cells = irq_parent.address_cells();
149
150            for _ in 0..address_cells {
151                data.take_u32()
152                    .map_err(|_| FdtError::BufferTooSmall { pos: data.pos() })?;
153            }
154
155            let parent_irq_cells = irq_parent.interrupt_cells()? as usize;
156
157            // Parse parent IRQ (variable number of cells)
158            let mut parent_irq = Vec::with_capacity(parent_irq_cells);
159            for _ in 0..parent_irq_cells {
160                let irq = data
161                    .take_u32()
162                    .map_err(|_| FdtError::BufferTooSmall { pos: data.pos() })?;
163                parent_irq.push(irq);
164            }
165
166            // Apply mask to child address and IRQ
167            let masked_address: Vec<u32> = child_address
168                .iter()
169                .enumerate()
170                .map(|(idx, value)| {
171                    let mask_value = mask.get(idx).copied().unwrap_or(0xffff_ffff);
172                    value & mask_value
173                })
174                .collect();
175            let masked_irq: Vec<u32> = child_irq
176                .iter()
177                .enumerate()
178                .map(|(idx, value)| {
179                    let mask_value = mask
180                        .get(child_addr_cells + idx)
181                        .copied()
182                        .unwrap_or(0xffff_ffff);
183                    value & mask_value
184                })
185                .collect();
186
187            mappings.push(PciInterruptMap {
188                child_address: masked_address,
189                child_irq: masked_irq,
190                interrupt_parent,
191                parent_irq,
192            });
193        }
194
195        Ok(mappings)
196    }
197
198    /// Get the bus range property if present
199    pub fn bus_range(&self) -> Option<Range<u32>> {
200        self.node.find_property("bus-range").and_then(|prop| {
201            let mut data = prop.data.buffer();
202            let start = data.take_u32().ok()?;
203            let end = data.take_u32().unwrap_or(start);
204            Some(start..end)
205        })
206    }
207
208    /// Get the device_type property (should be "pci" for PCI nodes)
209    pub fn device_type(&self) -> Option<&str> {
210        self.node
211            .find_property("device_type")
212            .and_then(|prop| prop.str().ok())
213    }
214
215    /// Check if this is a PCI host bridge
216    pub fn is_pci_host_bridge(&self) -> bool {
217        self.device_type() == Some("pci")
218            || self.node.name().contains("pci")
219            || self.node.compatibles().iter().any(|c| c.contains("pci"))
220    }
221
222    /// Get the ranges property for address translation
223    pub fn ranges(&self) -> Option<Vec<PciRange>> {
224        let prop = self.node.find_property("ranges")?;
225        let mut data = prop.data.buffer();
226        let mut ranges = Vec::new();
227
228        // PCI ranges format: <child-bus-address parent-bus-address size>
229        // child-bus-address: 3 cells (pci.hi pci.mid pci.lo)
230        // parent-bus-address: 2 cells for 64-bit systems (high, low)
231        // size: 2 cells for 64-bit sizes (high, low)
232        while !data.remain().as_ref().is_empty() {
233            // Parse child bus address (3 cells for PCI)
234            let mut child_addr = [0u32; 3];
235            for addr in child_addr.iter_mut() {
236                *addr = data.take_u32().ok()?;
237            }
238
239            // Parse parent bus address (2 cells for 64-bit)
240            let parent_addr_high = data.take_u32().ok()?;
241            let parent_addr_low = data.take_u32().ok()?;
242            let parent_addr = ((parent_addr_high as u64) << 32) | (parent_addr_low as u64);
243
244            // Parse size (2 cells for 64-bit)
245            let size_high = data.take_u32().ok()?;
246            let size_low = data.take_u32().ok()?;
247            let size = ((size_high as u64) << 32) | (size_low as u64);
248
249            // Extract PCI address space and prefetchable from child_addr[0]
250            let pci_hi = child_addr[0];
251            let (space, prefetchable) = self.decode_pci_address_space(pci_hi);
252
253            // Calculate bus address from child_addr[1:2]
254            let bus_address = ((child_addr[1] as u64) << 32) | (child_addr[2] as u64);
255
256            ranges.push(PciRange {
257                space,
258                bus_address,
259                cpu_address: parent_addr,
260                size,
261                prefetchable,
262            });
263        }
264
265        Some(ranges)
266    }
267
268    /// Decode PCI address space from the high cell of PCI address
269    fn decode_pci_address_space(&self, pci_hi: u32) -> (PciSpace, bool) {
270        // PCI address high cell format:
271        // Bits 31-28: 1 for IO space, 2 for Memory32, 3 for Memory64
272        // Bit 30: Prefetchable for memory spaces
273        let space_code = (pci_hi >> 24) & 0x03;
274        let prefetchable = (pci_hi >> 30) & 0x01 == 1;
275
276        let space = match space_code {
277            1 => PciSpace::IO,
278            2 => PciSpace::Memory32,
279            3 => PciSpace::Memory64,
280            _ => PciSpace::Memory32, // Default fallback
281        };
282
283        (space, prefetchable)
284    }
285
286    /// Get interrupt information for a specific PCI device
287    /// Parameters: bus, device, function, pin (0=INTA, 1=INTB, 2=INTC, 3=INTD)
288    pub fn child_interrupts(
289        &self,
290        bus: u32,
291        device: u32,
292        function: u32,
293        pin: u32,
294    ) -> Result<PciInterruptInfo, FdtError> {
295        // Try to get interrupt-map and mask, fall back to simpler approach if parsing fails
296        let interrupt_map = self.interrupt_map()?;
297
298        let mut mask = self
299            .interrupt_map_mask()
300            .ok_or(FdtError::PropertyNotFound("interrupt-map-mask"))?;
301
302        // Construct the child address for PCI device
303        // Format: [bus_num, device_num, func_num] in appropriate bits
304        let child_addr_high =
305            ((bus & 0xff) << 16) | ((device & 0x1f) << 11) | ((function & 0x7) << 8);
306        let child_addr_mid = 0;
307        let child_addr_low = 0;
308
309        let child_addr_cells = self.address_cells() as usize;
310        let child_irq_cells = self.interrupt_cells() as usize;
311        let required_mask_len = child_addr_cells + child_irq_cells;
312        if mask.len() < required_mask_len {
313            mask.resize(required_mask_len, 0xffff_ffff);
314        }
315
316        let encoded_address = [child_addr_high, child_addr_mid, child_addr_low];
317        let mut masked_child_address = Vec::with_capacity(child_addr_cells);
318        for (idx, mask) in mask.iter().enumerate().take(child_addr_cells) {
319            let value = *encoded_address.get(idx).unwrap_or(&0);
320            masked_child_address.push(value & mask);
321        }
322
323        let encoded_irq = [pin];
324        let mut masked_child_irq = Vec::with_capacity(child_irq_cells);
325        for idx in 0..child_irq_cells {
326            let value = *encoded_irq.get(idx).unwrap_or(&0);
327            masked_child_irq.push(value & mask[child_addr_cells + idx]);
328        }
329
330        // Look for matching entry in interrupt-map
331        for mapping in &interrupt_map {
332            // Check if this mapping matches our masked address and pin
333            if mapping.child_address == masked_child_address
334                && mapping.child_irq == masked_child_irq
335            {
336                return Ok(PciInterruptInfo {
337                    irqs: mapping.parent_irq.clone(),
338                });
339            }
340        }
341        let simple_irq = (device * 4 + pin) % 32;
342        Ok(PciInterruptInfo {
343            irqs: vec![simple_irq],
344        })
345    }
346}
347
348impl Debug for Pci {
349    fn fmt(&self, f: &mut core::fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> core::fmt::Result {
350        f.debug_struct("Pci")
351            .field("name", &self.node.name())
352            .field("is_pci_host_bridge", &self.is_pci_host_bridge())
353            .field("bus_range", &self.bus_range())
354            .field("interrupt_map_mask", &self.interrupt_map_mask())
355            .finish()
356    }
357}
358
359impl Deref for Pci {
360    type Target = NodeBase;
361
362    fn deref(&self) -> &Self::Target {
363        &self.node
364    }
365}
366
367#[cfg(test)]
368mod tests {
369    use crate::{cache::node::Node, Fdt};
370
371    #[test]
372    fn test_pci_node_detection() {
373        let dtb_data = include_bytes!("../../../../dtb-file/src/dtb/qemu_pci.dtb");
374        let fdt = Fdt::from_bytes(dtb_data).unwrap();
375
376        // Try to find PCI nodes
377        let mut pci_nodes_found = 0;
378        for node in fdt.find_nodes("/") {
379            {
380                if let Node::Pci(pci) = node {
381                    pci_nodes_found += 1;
382                    // println!("Found PCI node: {}", pci.name());
383                    assert!(pci.is_pci_host_bridge());
384                }
385            }
386        }
387
388        // We should find at least one PCI node in the qemu PCI test file
389        assert!(pci_nodes_found > 0, "Should find at least one PCI node");
390    }
391
392    #[test]
393    fn test_interrupt_map_parsing() {
394        let dtb_data = include_bytes!("../../../../dtb-file/src/dtb/qemu_pci.dtb");
395        let fdt = Fdt::from_bytes(dtb_data).unwrap();
396
397        // Look for a PCI node with interrupt-map
398        for node in fdt.find_nodes("/") {
399            {
400                if let Node::Pci(pci) = node {
401                    if let Ok(interrupt_map) = pci.interrupt_map() {
402                        assert!(!interrupt_map.is_empty());
403                        return; // Test passed if we found and parsed interrupt-map
404                    }
405                }
406            }
407        }
408
409        // If we get here, no interrupt-map was found
410        // println!("No interrupt-map found in any PCI node");
411    }
412
413    #[test]
414    fn test_interrupt_map_mask() {
415        let dtb_data = include_bytes!("../../../../dtb-file/src/dtb/qemu_pci.dtb");
416        let fdt = Fdt::from_bytes(dtb_data).unwrap();
417
418        for node in fdt.find_nodes("/") {
419            {
420                if let Node::Pci(pci) = node {
421                    if let Some(mask) = pci.interrupt_map_mask() {
422                        // println!("Found interrupt-map-mask: {:?}", mask);
423                        assert_eq!(mask.len(), 4, "PCI interrupt-map-mask should have 4 cells");
424                        return; // Test passed
425                    }
426                }
427            }
428        }
429
430        // println!("No interrupt-map-mask found in any PCI node");
431    }
432
433    #[test]
434    fn test_bus_range() {
435        let dtb_data = include_bytes!("../../../../dtb-file/src/dtb/qemu_pci.dtb");
436        let fdt = Fdt::from_bytes(dtb_data).unwrap();
437
438        for node in fdt.find_nodes("/") {
439            {
440                if let Node::Pci(pci) = node {
441                    if let Some(range) = pci.bus_range() {
442                        // println!("Found bus-range: {}-{}", start, end);
443                        assert!(range.start <= range.end, "Bus range start should be <= end");
444                        return; // Test passed
445                    }
446                }
447            }
448        }
449
450        // println!("No bus-range found in any PCI node");
451    }
452
453    #[test]
454    fn test_pci_properties() {
455        let dtb_data = include_bytes!("../../../../dtb-file/src/dtb/qemu_pci.dtb");
456        let fdt = Fdt::from_bytes(dtb_data).unwrap();
457
458        for node in fdt.find_nodes("/") {
459            {
460                if let Node::Pci(pci) = node {
461                    // Test address cells
462                    assert_eq!(pci.address_cells(), 3, "PCI should use 3 address cells");
463
464                    // Test interrupt cells
465                    assert_eq!(pci.interrupt_cells(), 1, "PCI should use 1 interrupt cell");
466
467                    // Test device type
468                    if let Some(device_type) = pci.device_type() {
469                        assert!(!device_type.is_empty());
470                    }
471
472                    // Test compatibles
473                    let compatibles = pci.compatibles();
474                    if !compatibles.is_empty() {
475                        // println!("Compatibles: {:?}", compatibles);
476                    }
477
478                    return; // Test passed for first PCI node found
479                }
480            }
481        }
482
483        panic!("No PCI nodes found for property testing");
484    }
485}
